keyPolicies.policyDescription: Britain should be a democratic, self-governing country.
We need to leave the EU in order to return control to Britain.
We must control our borders, in order to benefit British people.
Roads, housing, hospitals, GP surgeries and schools are at breaking point with uncontrolled mass immigration.
Rebuilding our prosperity must be based on lower taxes and energy costs.
We must safeguard against crime, including deporting foreign criminals.
We must continue to provide care and support for all who need it, with an NHS free at the point of delivery.
Free speech is paramount, political correctness must not stifle it.

issues.brexitEurope: We need to leave the EU in order to return control to Britain.
issues.economy: Rebuilding our prosperity must be based on lower taxes and energy costs.
issues.governance: Britain should be a democratic, self-governing country.

housing.content: Roads, housing, hospitals, GP surgeries and schools are at breaking point with uncontrolled mass immigration.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born in Southend; my family were part of Southend life: my mother played piano in pubs, her relatives ran a fish restaurant, barber shop and penny arcade. After qualifying as an engineer, I served in the Royal Air Force for 21 years. Worked in the IT industry for as many years since. In 2013, after years of frustration at the way we are governed I joined UKIP, never having been a member of a political party before. I am standing as your UKIP candidate on 7th May 2015. Please join me and help to make history, changing Westminster politics, forever.

images.caption: Brian Otridge - Vote for a UKIP Westminster MP on 7th May
